name: T - Nina
_source: multi_add_portrait;Nina;Left;Emma;Right
speak;Emma; Nina, what are you doing?
speak;Nina; I'm making target dummies for me and Emily.{w} She wanted to see who's a better shot!
speak;Emma; Mhm, you're such a good shot that you need to whittle down her bostring there?
speak;Nina; Er, well if she didn't want me to cheat, maybe she shouldn't have let me steal it.
speak;Emma; Is this why they call you The Lawbreaker?
speak;Nina;Oh, that?
speak;Nina; It's because I'm a wanted criminal nearly everywhere.{w} I've actually got a collection of wanted posters in my quiver.
speak;Emma; Despite how you say that, I'm not sure it's something to be proud of.

speak;Nina; Back in my hometown, I was raised in a poor family where it was hard for us to live.{w} So, from a young age, I had to learn to steal and wield a weapon.{w} I had a good teacher, and it turns out I'm a good shot, so I chose the bow.
speak;Emma; You had a teacher? Who could've taught The Lawbreaker?
speak;Nina; Duh, I had a teacher.{w} As for who he was{tgm}...{tgm} I have no clue.
speak;Emma;Wh-
bop_portrait;Emma
speak;Emma; How do you not know your own teacher's name?!
speak;Nina; When you're wanted enough,{w} I guess it's better to not tell people your name.{w} He was apparently an assassin passing through,{w} decided to take a break and train someone.
speak;Emma; Huh, interesting{tgm}...
speak;Emma; Sounds like you lived a hard life before joining The Defiants.

speak;Nina; Sarah actually initially sought me out to turn me in for the reward money,{w} but she saw my skills and thought I'd be better off fighting on her side.{w} Of course we weren't exactly the most trusting duo,{w} but we warmed up to each other after a while.
speak;Emma; How did she even manage to catch you in the first place?{w} Like, did you guys talk?{w} Was there some huge fight first?

speak;Nina; Sarah managed to get the jump on me,{w} and we had a tense fight in this thick forest.{w} I flung arrows from the shadows while she darted from the trees,{w} trying to sneak up on me.{w} Embarassingly enough, I was too focused on looking out for Sarah,{w} and I didn't realize that I had walked straight into a trap.{w} Well, I realized after I was tied up in a net, of course.
speak;Emma; I'm sure the net was very well disguised,{w} but alas, we shall never know just how oblivious you were.

speak;Nina; Mhm, yeah, sure.{w} Sarah got me out of that hell- hole of a town I was born from,{w} and gave me the chance to steal <bconvo>all around the country</>.{w} I send money to my family so they continue living well.{w} They don't write back often, but I like to imagine they have it good.
speak;Emma; You don't want to{tgm}...{tgm}visit them?{w} They are family, after all.
speak;Nina; Sometimes you've just got to leave the past behind.{w} There ain't anything back with my family that I need.{w} The Defiants are my real family now.
speak;Emma; I think if you really wanted to leave them in the past, you wouldn't send them money.
speak;Nina;...;no_talk
speak;Emma; Am I wrong?
speak;Nina; I think I'd prefer if you don't talk about my personal life.{w} I'm Nina, The Lawbreaker, and you don't need to know any more.
speak;Emma;...{tgm}Fine.;no_talk
speak;Nina;...;no_talk
speak;Emma; Anyway, you might want to save those target dummies for another time{tgm}...{tgm}{w} Emily's too busy losing her breakfast over the side of the boat to shoot straight.
speak;Nina; I thought the side of the boat smelled rather{tgm}...{tgm}putrid.{w} I should probably replace this bowstring before she notices, then{tgm}...
